question: Who will fix the domestic air fares of India for three months, when domestic flights resume after lock-down?
option3: Union Civil Aviation Ministry of India
answer: Union Civil Aviation Ministry of India
explanation:
As per the recent announcement from the Union Aviation Ministry, the domestic airfares of India will be fixed by the Ministry for three months, when domestic flights resume after lock-down.
The government will cap minimum and maximum ticket fares based on route and will ensure that ticket prices are affordable for passengers as well as financially viable for airlines. The Ministry has divided the routes into seven bands based on duration of flights. 40 per cent of the seats in any flight will have to be sold at the mid-point of the lower and upper air fare limits prescribed.
